channel.title: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!
channel.description:
Before you tell me to view tutorials or google it or whatever else, let me make it clear that I've been working on this for 2 weeks. I've viewed at least 6 different tutorials on how to make a webclient and 3-4 tutorials on how to jar and sign your client and have searched for hours trying to figure out why I'm getting this error. I'm 99% sure I've done everything correctly, but I'm still getting this error.
Base: Delta Client: Bluur
Error:
[code] load: class client.class not found. java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class [/code]
How do I fix this? I've tried almost everything, yet I still get this same error. Thanks in advance for any help I get.

item.title: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @legit_99 legit 99
item.description:
@legit_99 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:412139”][quote author=legit 99 link=topic=513390.msg3728697#msg3728697 date=1314472627]
So I just remove the extension, rejar/sign it, upload to my webhost then my webclient should load?

^That didn’t work.

I’m completely out of ideas on what to do.
[/quote]

No, you don’t removet he extension.

Edit your HTML file, and in the applet tag, change “client.class” to “client”.[/quote]

That didn’t work either. My friend said it’s because I have a file bar thing around my client. I’m going to try switching clients and see if it works…

Read full topic
item.source: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!

item.title: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“legit 99, post:6, topic:412139”]So I just remove the extension, rejar/sign it, upload to my webhost then my webclient should load?

^That didn’t work.

I’m completely out of ideas on what to do.[/quote]

No, you don’t removet he extension.

Edit your HTML file, and in the applet tag, change “client.class” to “client”.

item.source: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!

item.title: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“legit 99, post:4, topic:412139”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=513390.msg3727659#msg3727659 date=1314397281]

Before you tell me to view tutorials or google it or whatever else, let me make it clear that I’ve been working on this for 2 weeks. I’ve viewed at least 6 different tutorials on how to make a webclient and 3-4 tutorials on how to jar and sign your client and have searched for hours trying to figure out why I’m getting this error. I’m 99% sure I’ve done everything correctly, but I’m still getting this error.

Base: Delta
Client: Bluur

Error:

load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

How do I fix this? I’ve tried almost everything, yet I still get this same error.
Thanks in advance for any help I get.

The problem is that there’s no such thing as class client.class. Just like when running java from a local computer, you don’t include the extension. For example, you would do

java Main

and not

java Main.class
[/quote]

The file had no extension on it when jarred and signed originally… So I put one on it and then I still get the same error…[/quote]

It has an extension; you probably just have the “hide known extensions” option on in the View menu.

Read full topic

Before you tell me to view tutorials or google it or whatever else, let me make it clear that I’ve been working on this for 2 weeks. I’ve viewed at least 6 different tutorials on how to make a webclient and 3-4 tutorials on how to jar and sign your client and have searched for hours trying to figure out why I’m getting this error. I’m 99% sure I’ve done everything correctly, but I’m still getting this error.

Base: Delta
Client: Bluur

Error:

load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

How do I fix this? I’ve tried almost everything, yet I still get this same error.
Thanks in advance for any help I get.
[/quote]

The problem is that there’s no such thing as class client.class. Just like when running java from a local computer, you don’t include the extension. For example, you would do

java Main

and not

java Main.class[/quote]

The file had no extension on it when jarred and signed originally… So I put one on it and then I still get the same error…

item.title: Webclient "class client.class not found" error 317 delta base HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“legit 99, post:1, topic:412139”]Before you tell me to view tutorials or google it or whatever else, let me make it clear that I’ve been working on this for 2 weeks. I’ve viewed at least 6 different tutorials on how to make a webclient and 3-4 tutorials on how to jar and sign your client and have searched for hours trying to figure out why I’m getting this error. I’m 99% sure I’ve done everything correctly, but I’m still getting this error.

Base: Delta
Client: Bluur

Error:

load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass0(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
	at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

How do I fix this? I’ve tried almost everything, yet I still get this same error.
Thanks in advance for any help I get.[/quote]

The problem is that there’s no such thing as class client.class. Just like when running java from a local computer, you don’t include the extension. For example, you would do

java Main

and not

java Main.class
